alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 11:37PM PST until March 01 at 11:34PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... South Prairie Creek at South Prairie affecting Pierce County. .Heavy rain will continue through tonight before tapering on Tuesday. Continued rainfall will help keep many area rivers above flood stage through Tuesday. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Prairie Creek at South Prairie. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 5500.0 cfs, South Prairie Creek will cause flooding from above the Town of South Prairie downstream to the Carbon River. Flood waters will inundate roads, residential areas, and farms, including South Prairie - Carbon River Rd., South Prairie Rd. East, Spring Site Rd., and SR 162. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM PST Monday the flow was 3510.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon and continue falling to 5524.3 cfs late tonight. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood flow is 4000.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 745 AM PST.
